event_definitions.title: Amadeus : esb.amadeus-mq-pnr-feed : exception occurred
event_definitions.description:
An exception occurred in esb.amadeus-mq-pnr-feed, please check if:
- there's an issue when executing the PNR DB procedure pnr_newmessage
- there's an issue with Amadeus SBRRES feed

Please check logs here:
https://graylog.in.tmp.lu/streams/5cdd22bafc4bf60b0783dbb9/search?rangetype=relative&fields=message%2Csource&width=1920&highlightMessage=&relative=86400&q=level%3A(%3C%3D3)

More info in the code repository of amadeus-mq-pnr-feed:
https://gitlab.tmp.lu/mule4/amadeus-mq-pnr-feed#amadeus-pnr-feed

event_definitions.title: Anormal high amount of requests on Mytmp API
event_definitions.description: Stream URL: https://graylog.in.tmp.lu/streams/5cb05cadfc4bf64bfa8ff430/search?rangetype=relative&fields=message%2Csource&width=1920&highlightMessage=&relative=1800&q=mule_app_name%3Amytmp%20%26%26%20%22%5C%2Fauthenticate%20HTTP%22

event_definitions.title: BTN : (Bewotec) Timeout

config.query: full_message:"Failed to route event via endpoint:" OR full_message:"TEXT=977" OR full_message:"Cannot get connection for URL"

event_definitions.description: Detect corrupt file in aixlog.txt

event_definitions.title: Booking-API : BL : BK Error
event_definitions.description: A BK- error occurred in the Booking API for a BL product

config.query: log_level:Error AND x_travel_type:BL AND full_message:"errorDescription: BK"

event_definitions.title: Booking-API : BL : non BK Error
event_definitions.description: A non BK- error occurred in the Booking API for a BL product

config.query: log_level:Error AND x_travel_type:BL AND full_message:"errorDescription:" AND NOT full_message:"errorDescription: BK"

event_definitions.title: ESB node down / deployment in progress ?
event_definitions.description:
HTTP 503 error (service not available) is returned by at least one ESB node.

Please verify : https://graylog.in.tmp.lu/streams/5cb05cadfc4bf64bfa8ff430/search?rangetype=relative&fields=source%2Chttp_status%2Cmessage%2Cmule_app_name&width=1680&highlightMessage=&relative=900&q=http_status%3A503

event_definitions.title: Error in the Blank-API
event_definitions.description: An error occurred in the Blank-API

event_definitions.title: Error in the Content-hub
event_definitions.description: An error occurred in the Content-hub.

event_definitions.title: Eurocontrol MQ
event_definitions.description:
Errors were logged by Eurocontrol app. Please check logs and ensure we are still connected to their MQ broker: 
https://graylog.in.tmp.lu/streams/5c9897d4fc4bf64bfa7627a1/search?rangetype=relative&fields=message%2Csource&width=1920&highlightMessage=&relative=86400&q=level%3A(%3C%3D3)

More info: https://gitlab.tmp.lu/mule4/eurocontrol

event_definitions.title: No Apra file start message were received in the last 60 minutes
event_definitions.description: Check the following stream: https://graylog.in.tmp.lu/streams/5efa59f2504d230014f5bd6f/search?interval=hour&width=1920&relative=172800&page=1&sortOrder=desc&q=%22Get%20Amadeus%20file%22%20%26%26%20class_name%3Alu.tmpgroup.transaction.feed&rangetype=relative&fields=message%2Csource&sortField=timestamp

event_definitions.title: No DCS event received since 3 hours
event_definitions.description:
Migrated message count alert condition

If the error occurred between 23:00 and 04:00, please ignore it / don't create an incident in this case.

Otherwise, read the troubleshooting article: https://gitlab.tmp.lu/wiki/wiki/-/wikis/Troubleshooting/dcs-events

See latest logs here: https://graylog.in.tmp.lu/streams/5ac76030fc4bf609f3b2fe8d/search?rangetype=relative&fields=&width=1920&highlightMessage=&relative=172800&q=

event_definitions.title: The DCS feed processing failed or didn't run
event_definitions.description:
The DCS feed processing must occur 1 time per day around 04:00. Amadeus sends to file to ftp.tmp.lu in SFTP in the /PRD/incoming folder. Then, the Mule application dcs-dw-feeds is monitoring this folder and must start the processing automatically.

When the processing is done, a message "Processing done" is logged into Graylog.

No "Processing done" message was logged since 30 hours, that's why you receive this alert. Please check the logs with the link below and investigate:
https://graylog.in.tmp.lu/streams/5ac75f56fc4bf609f3b2fd9b/search?rangetype=relative&fields=message%2Csource&width=1920&highlightMessage=&relative=86400&q=

This article should help you to troubleshoot: https://gitlab.tmp.lu/wiki/wiki/-/wikis/Troubleshooting/dcs-dw-feed

event_definitions.title: XFTv2 : (Bewotec) Timeout
event_definitions.description: possible timeout of the Bewotec services

event_definitions.title: [IAM] Midpoint - Connection failed
event_definitions.description:
A connection to a subsystem failed (SAP HR, SAP Interim, LDAP, AD, ...)
Actions: 
- Access https://midpointp.in.tmp.lu/midpoint/admin/tasks
- if tasks are in FATAL status, look at the reasons (by clicking on the task), then end with 'Resume' task
- otherwise, false alarm

event_definitions.title: [IAM] Midpoint - Potential issues
event_definitions.description:
Detects if Midpoint encounters an unusual number of errors.
Actions: 
- Access https://midpointp.in.tmp.lu/midpoint/admin/tasks
- if tasks are in FATAL status, look at the reasons (by clicking on the task), then end with 'Resume' task
- otherwise, false alarm

config.query: "A problem with this connection has occurred"

event_definitions.title: flightops.FDM_SFTP_Service
event_definitions.description: Too many warnings within a given period of time

config.query: source: Scheduler AND app_name:flightops.FDM_SFTP_Service AND (log_level:Warning OR log_level:Error)

config.query: app_name: flightops.Flex_MTOM_Manager AND source:EFBP01 AND log_level:Error

event_definitions.title: php memory problem on drupal1 production
php memory problem on drupal2 production
voucher api - TDR file from Qwikcilver not treated as expected
event_definitions.description:
We normally receive a TDR file every 1 hour on ftp.tmp.lu with user qwikcilver into /TDR directory.
This alert is raised when a file treatment wasn't done as expected.
Please check this stream: https://graylog.in.tmp.lu/streams/5fc524364a402100120a0500/search

event_definitions.title: web.edocuments error
event_definitions.description:
At least one error occurred in the edocuments application.

Check this: https://graylog.in.tmp.lu/streams/5ee21b14504d230014d8335e/search?rangetype=relative&fields=message%2Csource&width=1920&highlightMessage=&relative=86400&q=level%3A(%3C%3D3)

This article could help you to solve the issue: https://gitlab.tmp.lu/wiki/wiki/-/wikis/Troubleshooting/edocuments-parking
